licence_overview:
$!You must tell your council if your commercial site uses a cooling tower or evaporative condenser.$!

Cooling towers and evaporative condensers help to remove excess heat from sites like power stations or chemical plants.

##Conditions

You must tell your council in writing if you have a cooling tower or evaporative condenser, unless:

* it contains no water that’s exposed to air
* its water supply is not connected
* its electrical supply is not connected

If you make any changes to your cooling tower or evaporative condenser, you must tell your council of these in writing immediately.

##How to apply

Contact your local council, as they will have their own forms for you to tell them.

^An inspection will follow to check how safe your site is.^

##Displaying your licence

Ask your council for details of how you should display your licence.
